chapter.title: Getting Started
chapter.para: This chapter provides a brief introduction to &PRODUCT;. It covers how to create, configure, manage, and build a full-featured blog, as well as how to change the theme or translate the blog to your language.

note.title: Tip
note.para: On UNIX-like systems such as GNU/Linux, you can use blaze-command and more convenient blaze command interchangeably. For a list of available commands, type the following at a shell prompt:

section.title: Creating a New Blog
section.para: To create a new blog, move into the directory you want to keep the blog in, and use the following command:
section.screen: ~]$ blaze-init Created a BlazeBlogger repository in .blaze.
section.para: This will create a hidden directory, .blaze/, in which the blog data will be kept. Note that the actual content of this directory is not important, and it is recommended that you never touch the files in it directly. To recover its content should it ever be damaged, use the same command again:
section.screen: ~]$ blaze-init Recovered a BlazeBlogger repository in .blaze.
